name: Energy Balls
description: No-bake energy bites made with dates, oats, and nut butter. Natural energy source for pre or post workout.

instructions.instruction: Remove pits from dates. If dates are hard, soak in hot water for 10 minutes, then drain.
instructions.tip: Soft dates are easier to process and create a stickier dough.

instructions.instruction: Add dates to food processor. Pulse 15-20 times until they form a sticky paste.
instructions.tip: Doesn't need to be completely smooth - some texture is fine.

instructions.instruction: Add rolled oats and pulse 5-6 times.
Add peanut butter, honey, and vanilla extract. Pulse again.
Add flaxseed, chia seeds, cinnamon, and salt. Process until mixture sticks together when pressed.
Add chocolate chips. Mix by hand with spatula or pulse 2-3 times.
instructions.tip: Don't over-process - keep chocolate chunks visible.

instructions.instruction: Test mixture: Take a small piece and roll. If it crumbles, add 1 tbsp water.
Wet your hands slightly (prevents sticking). Scoop about 1.5 tbsp of mixture.
Roll firmly between palms to form balls about 1 inch in diameter.
instructions.tip: Balls should be walnut-sized - about 2.5cm diameter.

instructions.instruction: Optional: Roll balls in shredded coconut for coating.
Refrigerate for at least 1 hour until firm. Transfer to airtight container.
instructions.tip: They taste better cold and have firmer texture.

tips: Dates are a natural sugar source - no refined sugar needed.
Eat 2 balls 30 minutes before workout for quick energy.
No food processor? Finely chop dates and mix by hand.
Keep balls uniform in size for consistent nutrition.
Prep on Sunday for ready snacks all week.
storageInfo: Refrigerate for 2 weeks, freeze for 3 months. Can be eaten frozen.
servingSuggestion: Keep in gym bag, office drawer, or car. Perfect for emergency energy needs.
variations: Tropical: Use dried mango and coconut.
Almond butter: Replace peanut butter with almond butter.
Protein boost: Add 2 tbsp protein powder.
